YAHOO.widget.MenuItem.name: YAHOO.widget.MenuItem

submenu.description:
Object specifying the submenu to be appended to the menu item. The value can be one of the following:
  • Object specifying a Menu instance.
  • Object literal specifying the menu to be created. Format: { id: [menu id], itemdata: [array of values for items] }.
  • String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu.
  • Object specifying the <div> element of the menu.

checked.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should be rendered 
with a checkmark.

target.description: String specifying the value for the "target" attribute of the menu item's anchor element. Specifying a target will require the user to click directly on the menu item's anchor node in order to cause the browser to navigate to the specified URL. When building a menu from existing HTML the value of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

url.description:
String specifying the URL for the menu item's anchor's 
"href" attribute.  When building a menu from existing HTML the value 
of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

text.description:
String specifying the text label for the menu item.  
When building a menu from existing HTML the value of this property
will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

selected.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should 
be highlighted.

strongemphasis.description:
Boolean indicating if the text of the menu item will be 
rendered with strong emphasis.  When building a menu from existing 
HTML the value of this property will be interpreted from the
menu's markup.

disabled.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should be disabled.  
(Disabled menu items are  dimmed and will not respond to user input 
or fire events.)

emphasis.description:
Boolean indicating if the text of the menu item will be 
rendered with emphasis.  When building a menu from existing HTML the 
value of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

helptext.description:
String specifying additional instructional text to 
accompany the text for the nenu item.

params.name: p_oObject
params.description: String specifying the text of the menu item.

params.name: p_oObject
params.description: Object specifying the <li> element of the menu item.

params.name: p_oObject
params.description: Object specifying the <optgroup> element of the menu item.

params.name: p_oObject
params.description: Object specifying the <option> element of the menu item.

params.name: p_oObject
params.description:
Object literal specifying the configuration
for the menu item. See configuration class documentation for more details.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the menu item. See configuration class documentation 
for more details.

constructors.description: Creates an item for a menu.

mouseOutEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has left the menu item.  Passes back 
the DOM Event object as an argument.

mouseUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse 
is over the menu item.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a key when the menu item has 
focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

focusEvent.description: Fires when the menu item receives focus.

keyPressEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key when the 
menu item has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

mouseOverEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has entered the menu item.  Passes 
back the DOM Event object as an argument.

blurEvent.description: Fires when the menu item loses the input focus.

mouseDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user mouses down on the menu item.  Passes 
back the DOM Event object as an argument.

clickEvent.description:
Fires when the user clicks the on the menu item.  Passes 
back the DOM Event object as an argument.

destroyEvent.description: Fires when the menu item's <li> element is removed from its parent <ul> element.

keyDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses a key when the menu item has 
focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

_createRootNodeStructure.description: Creates the core DOM structure for the menu item.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

configURL.description:
Event handler for when the "url" configuration property of 
the menu item changes.

focus.description:
Causes the menu item to receive the focus and fires the 
focus event.

_getFirstElement.description: Returns an HTML element's first HTML element node.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description:
Object 
reference specifying the element to be evaluated.

params.name: p_sTagName
params.description:
Optional. String specifying the tagname of 
the element to be retrieved.

_checkDOMNode.description: Determines if an object is an HTML element.

params.description: Object to be evaluated.

init.description:
The MenuItem class's initialization method. This method is 
automatically called by the constructor, and sets up all DOM references 
for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not 
already present.

toString.description: Returns a string representing the menu item.

blur.description:
Causes the menu item to lose focus and fires the 
onblur event.

params.description:

params.name: p_aArgs

params.description:
Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

Event handler for when the "helptext" configuration property 
of the menu item changes.

destroy.description: Removes the menu item's <li> element from its parent <ul> element.

getNextEnabledSibling.description: Finds the menu item's next enabled sibling.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

configEmphasis.description:
Event handler for when the "emphasis" configuration property
of the menu item changes.

was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

Event handler for when the "checked" configuration property 
of the menu item changes.

String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem

Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

Event handler for when the "disabled" configuration property

params.name: p_sPath
params.description: String specifying the path to the image.

_preloadImage.description:
Preloads an image by creating an image element from the 
specified path and appending the image to the body of the document.

_checkString.description: Determines if an object is a string.

params.name: p_oObject
params.description: Object to be evaluated.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

configSelected.description:
Event handler for when the "selected" configuration property 
of the menu item changes.

_initSubTree.description:
Iterates the source element's childNodes collection and uses 
the child nodes to instantiate other menus.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object representing the menu item
that fired the event.

configText.description:
Event handler for when the "text" configuration property of 
the menu item changes.

IMG_ROOT.description:
String representing the prefix path to use for 
non-secure images.

IMG_ROOT_SSL.description:
String representing the prefix path to use for securely 
served images.

CHECKED_IMAGE_PATH.description:
String representing the path to the image to be used for 
the checked state.

SELECTED_CHECKED_IMAGE_PATH.description:
String representing the path to the image to be used for 
the selected checked state.

COLLAPSED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_ALT_TEXT.description:
String representing the alt text for the image to be used 
for the submenu arrow indicator.

index.description:
Number indicating the ordinal position of the menu item in 
its group.

parent.description: Object reference to the menu item's parent menu.

DISABLED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_IMAGE_PATH.description:
String representing the path to the image to be used for the 
submenu arrow indicator when the menu item is disabled.

CHECKED_IMAGE_ALT_TEXT.description:
String representing the alt text for the image to be used 
for the checked image.

SELECTED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_IMAGE_PATH.description:
String representing the path to the image to be used for the 
submenu arrow indicator when the menu item is selected.

imageRoot.description:
String representing the root path for all of the menu 
item's images.

SUBMENU_INDICATOR_IMAGE_PATH.description:
String representing the path to the image to be used for the 
menu item's submenu arrow indicator.

groupIndex.description:
Number indicating the index of the group to which the menu 
item belongs.

_oSubmenu.description: Object reference to the menu item's submenu.

_oText.description: Object reference to the menu item's text node.

CSS_CLASS_NAME.description: String representing the CSS class(es) to be applied to the <li> element of the menu item.

SUBMENU_TYPE.description:
Object representing the type of menu to instantiate and 
add when parsing the child nodes of the menu item's source HTML element.

DISABLED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_ALT_TEXT.description:
String representing the alt text for the image to be used 
for the submenu arrow indicator when the menu item is disabled.

srcElement.description: Object reference to the HTML element (either <li>, <optgroup> or <option>) used create the menu item.

_checkImage.description: Object reference to the menu item's checkmark image.

EXPANDED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_ALT_TEXT.description:
String representing the alt text for the image to be used 
for the submenu arrow indicator when the submenu is visible.

isSecure.description:
Boolean representing whether or not the current browsing 
context is secure (HTTPS).

value.description: Object reference to the menu item's value.

element.description: Object reference to the menu item's <li> element.

DISABLED_CHECKED_IMAGE_PATH.description:
String representing the path to the image to be used for 
the disabled checked state.

_oAnchor.description: Object reference to the menu item's <a> element.

constructor.description: Object reference to the menu item's constructor function.

DISABLED_CHECKED_IMAGE_ALT_TEXT.description:
String representing the alt text for the image to be used 
for the checked image when the item is disabled.

submenuIndicator.description: Object reference to the <img> element used to create the submenu indicator for the menu item.

_oHelpTextEM.description: Object reference to the menu item's help text <em> element.

YAHOO.widget.MenuItem.description: Creates an item for a menu.

YAHOO.widget.MenuModule.name: YAHOO.widget.MenuModule
YAHOO.widget.MenuModule.deprecated:
As of version 0.12, all MenuModule functionality has been 
implemented directly in YAHOO.widget.Menu, making YAHOO.widget.Menu the base 
class for all menuing containers.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu module.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu module.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the menu module.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu module.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the menu module. See configuration class documentation for 
more details.

constructors.description: The base class for all menuing containers.

YAHOO.widget.MenuModule.description: The base class for all menuing containers.

YAHOO.widget.Menubar.name: YAHOO.widget.Menubar

position.description:
String indicating how a menu bar should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menu bars 
are visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menu bars are hidden by default, reside
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and can 
overlay other elements on the screen.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu bar item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner].

autosubmenudisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made 
visible when the user mouses over the menu bar's items.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu bar.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu bar.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the menu bar.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu bar.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the menu bar. See configuration class documentation for
more details.

constructors.description: Horizontal collection of items, each of which can contain a submenu.

params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oMenuBar
params.description:
Object representing the menu bar 
that fired the event.

_onClick.description: "click" event handler for the menu bar.

Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be

YAHOO.widget.MenuManager.name: YAHOO.widget.MenuManager

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object specifying the Menu  
instance to be added.

addMenu.description: Adds a menu to the collection of known menus.

params.name: p_oEvent
params.description:
Object representing the DOM event object passed 
back by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event).

onDOMEvent.description:
Generic, global event handler for all of a menu's DOM-based 
events.  This listens for events against the document object.  If the 
target of a given event is a member of a menu or menu item's DOM, the 
instance's corresponding Custom Event is fired.

params.name: p_sId
params.description:
String specifying the id of the menu to
be retrieved.

getMenu.description: Returns a menu with the specified id.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the menu that 
fired the event.

onMenuVisibleConfigChange.description:
Event handler for when the "visible" configuration property 
of a Menu instance changes.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description:
Object specifying 
an HTML element.

getMenuRootElement.description:
Finds the root DIV node of a menu or the root LI node of a 
menu item.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object specifying the MenuItem 
instance to be added.

addItem.description: Adds an item to the collection of known menu items.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the menu that 
fired the event.

params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

onItemRemoved.description: "itemremoved" event handler for a Menu instance.

toString.description: Returns a string representing the menu manager.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object specifying the MenuItem 
instance to be removed.

removeItem.description: Removes an item from the collection of known menu items.

getMenus.description:
Returns an array of all menus registered with the 
menu manger.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oItem
params.description:
Object representing the menu item 
that fired the event.

onItemDestroy.description: "destroy" event handler for a MenuItem instance.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

onItemAdded.description: "itemadded" event handler for a Menu instance.

hideVisible.description: Hides all visible, dynamically positioned menus.

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object specifying the Menu  
instance to be removed.

removeMenu.description: Removes a menu from the collection of known menus.

YAHOO.widget.MenuManager.description:
Singleton that manages a collection of all menus and menu items.  Listens for 
DOM events at the document level and dispatches the events to the 
corresponding menu or menu item.

YAHOO.widget.ContextMenu.name: YAHOO.widget.ContextMenu

trigger.description:
The HTML element(s) whose "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" 
for Opera) trigger the display of the context menu.  Can be a string 
representing the id attribute of the HTML element, an object reference 
for the HTML element, or an array of strings or HTML element references.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the context menu. See configuration class documentation 
for more details.

constructors.description:
Creates a list of options or commands which are made visible in response to 
an HTML element's "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" for Opera).

params.name: p_oEvent
params.description:
Object representing the DOM event object passed back 
by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event).

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the context 
menu that is handling the event.

_onTriggerClick.description:
"click" event handler for the HTML element(s) identified as the 
"trigger" for the context menu.  Used to cancel default behaviors in Opera.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the context menu. See configuration class documentation 
for more details.

init.description:
The ContextMenu class's initialization method. This method is 
automatically called by the constructor, and sets up all DOM references for 
pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

toString.description: Returns a string representing the context menu.

_removeEventHandlers.description:
Removes all of the DOM event handlers from the HTML element(s) 
whose "context menu" event ("click" for Opera) trigger the display of 
the context menu.

destroy.description: Removes the context menu's <div> element (and accompanying child nodes) from the document.

params.name: p_oEvent
params.description:
Object representing the DOM event object passed back 
by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event).

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the context 
menu that is handling the event.

_onTriggerContextMenu.description:
"contextmenu" event handler ("mousedown" for Opera) for the HTML 
element(s) that trigger the display of the context menu.

initDefaultConfig.description:
Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be 
changed using the context menu's Config object ("cfg").

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the context 
menu that fired the event.

configTrigger.description:
Event handler for when the value of the "trigger" configuration 
property changes.

_oTrigger.description:
Object reference to the current value of the "trigger" 
configuration property.

contextEventTarget.description:
Object reference for the HTML element that was the target of the
"contextmenu" DOM event ("mousedown" for Opera) that triggered the display of 
the context menu.

YAHOO.widget.ContextMenu.description:
Creates a list of options or commands which are made visible in response to 
an HTML element's "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" for Opera).

configuration for the menu module item. See configuration class documentation
for more details.

constructors.description: Creates an item for a menu module.

YAHOO.widget.MenuModuleItem.description: Creates an item for a menu module.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.name: YAHOO.widget.Menu

autosubmenudisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made 
visible when the user mouses over the menu's items.

clicktohide.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will automatically be 
hidden if the user clicks outside of it.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner]. By default
a submenu's top left corner is aligned to its parent menu item's top 
right corner.

constraintoviewport.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will try to remain inside 
the boundaries of the size of viewport.

showdelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is made visible when the user mouses over 
the menu's items.

submenuhidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of a menu item 
heading in the direction of a submenu.  The value must be greater than or 
equal to the value specified for the "showdelay" configuration property.

visible.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the menu is visible. If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "dynamic" (the default), this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "visibility" style property between "visible" (true) or "hidden" (false). If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "static" this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "display" style property between "block" (true) or "none" (false).

container.description:
HTML element reference or string specifying the id 
attribute of the HTML element that the menu's markup should be rendered into.

position.description:
String indicating how a menu should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menus are 
visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menus are hidden by default, reside 
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and 
can overlay other elements on the screen.

hidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before the menu is hidden.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the menu. See configuration class documentation for 
more details.

constructors.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

mouseOutEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has left the menu.  Passes back the DOM 
Event object as an argument.

mouseUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is 
over the menu.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyPressEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key when one of the
menu's items has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemAddedEvent.description: Fires when an item is added to the menu.

mouseOverEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has entered the menu.  Passes back 
the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemRemovedEvent.description: Fires when an item is removed to the menu.

mouseDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user mouses down on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

clickEvent.description:
Fires when the user clicks the on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

keyDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.description:

fired the event.

item to "false" and hides the item's submenu.

setInitialSelection.description:
Sets the "selected" configuration property of the menu's first 
enabled item to "true."

destroy.description: Removes the menu's <div> element (and accompanying child nodes) from the document.

configPosition.description:
Event handler for when the "position" configuration property 
of the menu changes.

initDefaultConfig.description:
Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be
changed using the menu's Config object ("cfg").

_execHideDelay.description:
Hides the menu after the number of milliseconds specified by 
the "hidedelay" configuration property.

activeItem.description: Object reference to the item in the menu that has focus.

CSS_CLASS_NAME.description: String representing the CSS class(es) to be applied to the menu's <div> element.

lazyLoad.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu's "lazy load" feature is 
enabled.  If set to "true," initialization and rendering of the menu's 
items will be deferred until the first time it is made visible.  This 
property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

parent.description:
Object reference to the menu's parent menu or menu item.  
This property can be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

_nSubmenuHideDelayId.description:
Number representing the time-out setting used to cancel the 
hiding of a submenu.

_bHandledMouseOverEvent.description:
Boolean indicating the current state of the menu's 
"mouseover" event.

_nHideDelayId.description:
Number representing the time-out setting used to cancel the 
hiding of a menu.

srcElement.description: Object reference to the HTML element (either <select> or <div>) used to create the menu.

ITEM_TYPE.description: Object representing the type of menu item to instantiate and add when parsing the child nodes (either <li> element, <optgroup> element or <option>) of the menu's source HTML element.

GROUP_TITLE_TAG_NAME.description:
String representing the tagname of the HTML element used to 
title the menu's item groups.

_bHandledMouseOutEvent.description:
Boolean indicating the current state of the menu's
"mouseout" event.

_aGroupTitleElements.description: Array of HTML element used to title groups of menu items.

_aListElements.description: Array of <ul> elements, each of which is the parent node for each item's <li> element.

_nShowDelayId.description:
Number representing the time-out setting used to cancel the 
showing of a menu.

_hideDelayEventHandlersAssigned.description:
Boolean indicating if the "mouseover" and "mouseout" event 
handlers used for hiding the menu via a call to "window.setTimeout" have 
already been assigned.

itemData.description:
Array of items to be added to the menu.  The array can contain 
strings representing the text for each item to be created, object literals 
representing the menu item configuration properties, or MenuItem instances.  
This property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

menu.name: menu
menu.title: Menu Library
menu.description:
The Menu Library features a collection of widgets that make it easy to add menus to your website or web application. With the Menu Library you can create website fly-out menus, customized context menus, or application-style menu bars with just a small amount of scripting.

  • Screen-reader accessibility.
  • Keyboard and mouse navigation.
  • A rich event model that provides access to all of a menu's interesting moments.
  • Support for Progressive Enhancement; Menus can be created from simple, semantic markup on the page or purely through JavaScript.
